clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment and Rehabilitation of Patients With Hip Arthroplasty to Regain Walk and Work Efficiency and Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment and Rehabilitation of Patients With Hip Arthroplasty to Regain Walk and Work Efficiency and Quality of Life

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to detect differences in function between rehabilitated hip arthroplasty patients with customized prosthesis v. commercial prosthesis and to reveal if there exist differences in strength and cardiovascular capacity between hip arthroplasty patients and healthy controls.

arm_group.description: Hip arthroplasty one side, normal offset
Hip arthroplasty both sides, normal offset
Hip arthroplasty both sides, un-normal offset

study_pop.textblock: Subjects selected from orthopaedic out-patient department

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Undergone hip surgery 3-5 years ago
- Age < 70 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Heart or lung diseases
- Malign diseases
- No muscle/skeletal diseases that compromises testing
